item.flavor: Most pandaren say his brew tastes like yak. But apparently that's a compliment.

item.name: Ancient Mage
item.text: Battlecry: Give adjacent minions Spell Damage +1.
item.flavor: Sometimes he forgets and just wanders into someone else's game.

item.name: Ancient of Lore

item.flavor: Go ahead, carve your initials in him.

item.name: Ancient of War
item.text: Choose One - +5 Attack; or +5 Health and Taunt.
item.flavor: Young Night Elves love to play "Who can get the Ancient of War to Uproot?" You lose if you get crushed to death.

item.name: Ancient Secrets
item.text: Restore 5 Health.

item.name: Ancient Teachings
item.text: Draw 2 cards.

item.name: Ancient Watcher
item.text: Can't Attack.
item.flavor: Why do its eyes seem to follow you as you walk by?

item.name: Angry Chicken
item.text: Enrage: +5 Attack.
item.flavor: There is no beast more frightening (or ridiculous) than a fully enraged chicken.

item.name: Arathi Weaponsmith
item.text: Battlecry: Equip a 2/2 weapon.
item.flavor: 50% off fist weapons, limited time only!

item.name: Arcane Golem

item.flavor: Having Arcane golems at home really classes up the place, and as a bonus they are great conversation pieces.

item.name: Archmage Antonidas
item.text: Whenever you cast a spell, add a 'Fireball' spell to your hand.
item.flavor: Antonidas was the Grand Magus of the Kirin Tor, and Jaina's mentor. This was a big step up from being Grand Magus of Jelly Donuts.

item.name: Argent Commander
item.text: Charge, Divine Shield
item.flavor: The Argent Dawn stands vigilant against the Scourge, as well as people who cut in line at coffee shops.

item.name: Argent Protector
item.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion Divine Shield.
item.flavor: "I'm not saying you can dodge fireballs. I'm saying with this shield, you won't have to."

item.name: Argent Squire
item.text: Divine Shield
item.flavor: "I solemnly swear to uphold the Light, purge the world of darkness, and to eat only burritos." - The Argent Dawn Oath

item.name: Armorsmith

item.flavor: She accepts guild funds for repairs!

item.name: Auchenai Soulpriest

item.flavor: The Auchenai know the end is coming, but they're not sure when.

item.name: Avenging Wrath
item.text: Deal $8 damage randomly split among all enemies.
item.flavor: Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham!

item.name: Azure Drake
item.text: Spell Damage +1. Battlecry: Draw a card.
item.flavor: They initially planned to be the Beryl or Cerulean drakes, but those felt a tad too pretentious.

item.name: Bananas
item.text: Give a minion +1/+1.

item.flavor: Baron Geddon was Ragnaros's foremost lieutenant, until he got FIRED.

item.name: Battle Rage

item.text: Increased Attack.

item.name: Bestial Wrath
item.text: +2 Attack and Immune this turn.

item.name: Betrayal

item.name: Big Game Hunter
item.text: Battlecry: Destroy a minion with an Attack of 7 or more.
item.flavor: Mere devilsaurs no longer excite him. Soon he'll be trying to catch Onyxia with only a dull Krol Blade.

item.name: Bite
item.text: +4 Attack this turn.

item.name: Blade Flurry

item.name: Bloodrage
item.text: No durability loss.

item.name: Bloodsail Corsair

item.flavor: Every pirate uses the same four digits to access Automated Gold Dispensers. It's called the "Pirate's Code".

item.name: Bloodsail Raider

item.name: Coldlight Seer

item.flavor: The Coldlight murlocs reside in the darkest pits of the Abyssal Depths. So no, there's no getting away from murlocs.

item.name: Commanding Shout
item.text: Can't be reduced below 1 Health this turn.

item.name: Consume
item.text: Increased stats.

item.name: Counterspell
item.text: Secret: When your opponent casts a spell, Counter it.
item.flavor: What's the difference between a mage playing with Counterspell and a mage who isn't? The mage who isn't is getting Pyroblasted in the face.

item.name: Crazed Alchemist

item.flavor: "You'll love my new recipe!" he says... especially if you're not happy with your current number of limbs.

item.name: Cruel Taskmaster
item.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to a minion and give it +2 Attack.
item.flavor: "I'm going to need you to come in on Sunday." - Cruel Taskmaster

item.name: Cult Master
item.text: Whenever one of your other minions dies, draw a card.
item.flavor: She may be an evil cult master, but she still calls her parents once a week.

item.name: Dark Iron Dwarf
item.text: Battlecry: Give a minion +2 Attack this turn.

item.name: Deadly Shot
item.text: Destroy a random enemy minion.
item.flavor: Accuracy is not a highly valued trait among the mok'nathal. Deadliness is near the top, though.

item.name: Deathwing
item.text: Battlecry: Destroy all other minions and discard your hand.
item.flavor: Once a noble dragon known as Neltharion, Deathwing lost his mind and shattered Azeroth before finally being defeated. Daddy issues?

item.name: Defender of Argus
item.text: Battlecry: Give adjacent minions +1/+1 and Taunt.
item.flavor: You wouldn’t think that Argus would need this much defending. But it does.

item.name: Defias Ringleader
item.text: Combo: Summon a 2/1 Defias Bandit.
item.flavor: He stole the deed to town years ago, so technically the town is his. He just calls people Scrub to be mean.

item.name: Demigod's Favor
item.text: Give your other minions +2/+2.

item.name: Demolisher
item.text: At the start of your turn, deal 2 damage to a random enemy.
item.flavor: Laying siege isn't fun for anyone. It's not even all that effective, now that everyone has a flying mount.

item.name: Demonfire
item.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion. If it’s a friendly Demon, give it +2/+2 instead.
item.flavor: Demonfire is like regular fire except for IT NEVER STOPS BURNING HELLLPPP

item.name: Demonfire
item.text: This Demon has +2/+2.

item.name: Dire Wolf Alpha
item.text: Adjacent minions have +1 Attack.

item.name: Dispel
item.text: Silence a minion.

item.name: Divine Favor

item.flavor: This is not just a favor, but a divine one, like helping someone move a couch with a fold out bed!

item.name: Doomguard

item.flavor: Summoning a doomguard is risky. Someone is going to die.

item.name: Doomhammer
item.text: Windfury, Overload: (2)
item.flavor: Orgrim Doomhammer gave this legendary weapon to Thrall. His name is a total coincidence.

item.name: Doomsayer

item.flavor: He's almost been right so many times. He was sure it was coming during the Cataclysm.

item.name: Dread Corsair

item.flavor: "Yarrrr" is a pirate word that means "Greetings, milord."

item.text: Taunt

item.name: Druid of the Claw
item.text: Charge

item.name: Dust Devil
item.text: Windfury. Overload: (2)
item.flavor: Westfall is full of dust devils. And buzzards. And crazed golems. And pirates. Why does anyone live here?

item.name: Eaglehorn Bow

item.flavor: First Lesson: Put the pointy end in the other guy.

item.name: Earth Elemental
item.text: Taunt. Overload: (3)
item.flavor: Nothing beats rock.

item.name: Earth Shock
item.text: Silence a minion, then deal $1 damage to it.
item.flavor: Earth Shock? Shouldn't it be "Azeroth Shock"?

item.name: Earthen Ring Farseer
item.text: Battlecry: Restore 3 Health.
item.flavor: He can see really far, and he doesn't use a telescope like those filthy pirates.

item.name: Edwin VanCleef
item.text: Combo: Gain +2/+2 for each card played earlier this turn.
item.flavor: He led the Stonemasons in the reconstruction of Stormwind, and when the nobles refused to pay, he founded the Defias Brotherhood to, well, deconstruct Stormwind.

item.text: Increased Health.
item.name: Elune's Grace
Emperor Cobra

item.flavor: The Sholazar Basin is home to a lot of really horrible things. If you're going to visit, wear bug spray. And plate armor.

item.name: Empowered
item.text: Mana Addict has increased Attack.

item.name: Equality
item.text: Change the Health of ALL minions to 1.
item.flavor: We are all special unique snowflakes... with 1 Health.

item.name: Equality
item.text: Health changed to 1.

item.name: Equipped
item.text: Increased Attack.

item.name: Ethereal Arcanist
item.text: If you control a Secret at the end of your turn, gain +2/+2.
item.flavor: The ethereals are wrapped in cloth to give form to their non-corporeal bodies. Also because it's nice and soft.

item.name: Eviscerate
item.text: Deal $2 damage. Combo: Deal $4 damage instead.
item.flavor: There is a high cost to Eviscerating your opponent: It takes a long time to get blood stains out of leather armor.

item.text: Attack and Health have been swapped by Crazed Alchemist.
item.name: Experiments!
Explosive Shot
item.text: Deal $5 damage to a minion and $2 damage to adjacent ones.
item.flavor: Pull the pin, count to 5, then shoot. Then duck.

item.name: Explosive Trap
item.text: Secret: When your hero is attacked, deal $2 damage to all enemies.
item.flavor: It traps your food AND cooks it for you!

item.name: Eye for an Eye
item.text: Secret: When your hero takes damage, deal that much damage to the enemy hero.
item.flavor: Justice sometimes takes the form of a closed fist into a soft cheek.

item.name: Faceless Manipulator
item.text: Battlecry: Choose a minion and become a copy of it.
item.flavor: The Faceless Ones are servants of Yogg-Saron, and they feed on fear. Right now they are feeding on your fear of accidentally disenchanting all your good cards.

item.name: Faerie Dragon
item.text: Can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.
item.flavor: Adorable. Immune to Magic. Doesn't pee on the rug. The perfect pet!

item.name: Far Sight
item.text: One of your cards costs (3) less.

item.name: Far Sight
item.text: Draw a card. That card costs (3) less.
item.flavor: Drek'thar can't see, but he can see. You know what I mean? It's ok if you don't.

item.name: Felguard
item.text: Taunt. Battlecry: Destroy one of your Mana Crystals.
item.flavor: Yes, he'll fight for you. BUT HE'S NOT GOING TO LIKE IT.

item.name: Fen Creeper
item.text: Taunt
item.flavor: He used to be called Bog Beast, but it confused people because he wasn't an actual beast. Boom, New Name!

item.name: Feral Spirit
item.text: Summon two 2/3 Spirit Wolves with Taunt. Overload: (2)
item.flavor: Spirit wolves are like regular wolves with pom-poms.

item.name: Flame Imp
item.text: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage to your hero.
item.flavor: Imps like being on fire. They just do.

item.name: Flare
item.text: All minions lose Stealth. Destroy all enemy Secrets. Draw a card.
item.flavor: Not only does it reveal your enemies, but it's also great for parties!

item.name: Flesheating Ghoul
item.text: Whenever a minion dies, gain +1 Attack.
item.flavor: 'Flesheating' is an unfair name. It's just that there's not really much else for him to eat.

item.name: Force of Nature
item.text: Summon three 2/2 Treants with Charge that die at the end of the turn.
item.flavor: "I think I'll just nap under these trees. Wait... AAAAAHHH!" - Blinkfizz, the Unfortunate Gnome

item.name: Forked Lightning
item.text: Deal $2 damage to 2 random enemy minions. Overload: (2)
item.flavor: If you combine it with Spooned Lightning and Knived Lightning, you have the full dining set.

item.name: Freezing Trap
item.text: Secret: When an enemy minion attacks, return it to its owner's hand and it costs (2) more.
item.flavor: "Dang, that's cold." - appropriate response to Freezing Trap, or a mean joke.

item.name: Frost Elemental
item.text: Battlecry: Freeze a character.
item.flavor: When a Water elemental and an Ice elemental love each other VERY much...

item.name: Frothing Berserker
item.text: Whenever a minion takes damage, gain +1 Attack.
item.flavor: He used to work as an accountant before he tried his hand at Berserkering.

item.text: +2/+2. Full of Murloc.

item.text: This minion has +2 Attack.
item.name: Full Strength
Gadgetzan Auctioneer

item.name: Gladiator's Longbow
item.text: Your hero is Immune while attacking.
item.flavor: The longbow allows shots to be fired from farther away and is useful for firing on particularly odorous targets.

item.name: Gnoll
item.text: Taunt

item.name: Grommash Hellscream
item.text: Charge Enrage: +6 Attack
item.flavor: Grommash drank the tainted blood of Mannoroth, dooming the orcs to green skin and red eyes! Maybe not his best decision.

item.text: Gruul is growing...
item.name: Growth
Gruul

item.text: +1/+1 and Taunt.

Harrison Jones

item.name: Harvest Golem

item.flavor: "Overheat threshold exceeded. System failure. Wheat clog in port two. Shutting down."

item.name: Headcrack

item.flavor: When all else fails, nothing beats a swift whack upside the head.

item.name: Hogger
item.text: At the end of your turn, summon a 2/2 Gnoll with Taunt.
item.flavor: Hogger is super powerful. If you kill him, it's because he let you.

item.name: Holy Fire

Increased Health.

item.name: Ice Barrier

item.name: Illidan Stormrage
item.text: Whenever you play a card, summon a 2/1 Flame of Azzinoth.
item.flavor: Illidan's brother, Malfurion, imprisoned him beneath Hyjal for 10,000 years. Stormrages are not good at letting go of grudges.

item.name: Imp Master

item.flavor: She would enjoy the job a lot more if she just could get the imps to QUIT BITING HER.

item.name: INFERNO!
item.text: Hero Power Summon a 6/6 Infernal.

item.name: Infusion
item.text: +3 Health.

item.name: Injured Blademaster
item.text: Battlecry: Deal 4 damage to HIMSELF.
item.flavor: He claims it is an old war wound, but we think he just cut himself shaving.

item.name: Inner Fire
item.text: This minion's Attack is equal to its Health.

item.name: Inner Fire

item.flavor: Good idea: Buffing your minions. Bad idea: Starting a conversation in the Barrens.

item.flavor: They're only smiling on the outside.

item.name: Inner Rage
item.text: +2 Attack.

item.text: Stealth
item.flavor: Stranglethorn is a beautiful place to visit, but you wouldn't want to live there.

item.name: Keeper of the Grove
item.text: Choose One - Deal 2 damage; or Silence a minion.
item.flavor: These guys just show up and start Keeping your Groves without even asking.

item.text: Increased stats.
item.name: Keeping Secrets
Kidnapper
item.text: Combo: Return a minion to its owner's hand.
item.flavor: He just wants people to see his vacation photos.

item.name: Kill Millhouse!
item.text: Spells cost (0) this turn!

item.name: King Krush
item.text: Charge
item.flavor: The best defense against King Krush is to have someone you don’t like standing in front of you.

item.name: King Mukla
item.text: Battlecry: Give your opponent 2 Bananas.
item.flavor: King Mukla wanders Jaguero Isle, searching for love.

item.name: Kirin Tor Mage
item.text: Battlecry: The next Secret you play this turn costs (0).
item.flavor: The Kirin Tor reside in the floating city of Dalaran. How do you make a Dalaran float? Two scoops of ice cream, one scoop of Dalaran.

item.name: Knife Juggler
item.text: After you summon a minion, deal 1 damage to a random enemy.
item.flavor: Ambitious Knife Jugglers sometimes graduate to Bomb Jugglers. They never last long enough to make it onto a card though.

item.name: Laughing Sister
item.text: Can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.

item.name: Lava Burst
item.text: Deal $5 damage. Overload: (2)
item.flavor: It's like an ocean of liquid magma in your mouth!

item.name: Lay on Hands
item.text: Restore #8 Health. Draw 3 cards.
item.flavor: A grammatically awkward life saver.

item.name: Leader of the Pack
item.text: Give your minions +1/+1.

item.name: Leeroy Jenkins
item.text: Charge. Battlecry: Summon two 1/1 Whelps for your opponent.
item.flavor: At least he has Angry Chicken.

item.name: Leper Gnome
item.text: Deathrattle: Deal 2 damage to the enemy hero.
item.flavor: He really just wants to be your friend, but the constant rejection is starting to really get to him.

item.text: Increased Attack and Health.
item.name: Level Up!
Lightning Bolt
item.text: Deal $3 damage. Overload: (1)
item.flavor: Lightning Bolt! Lightning Bolt! Lightning Bolt!

item.name: Lightning Storm
item.text: Deal $2-$3 damage to all enemy minions. Overload: (2)
item.flavor: An umbrella won't be effective, I'm afraid.

item.name: Lightspawn
item.text: This minion's Attack is always equal to its Health.
item.flavor: Spawn of the Light? Or Pawn of the Lights?

item.name: Lightwarden
item.text: Whenever a character is healed, gain +2 Attack.
item.flavor: She’s smaller than her sisters Mediumwarden and Heavywarden.

item.name: Lightwell
item.text: At the start of your turn, restore 3 Health to a damaged friendly character.
item.flavor: It isn't clear if people ignore the Lightwell, or if it is just invisible.

item.name: Loot Hoarder
item.text: Deathrattle: Draw a card.
item.flavor: Always roll need.

item.name: Lord Jaraxxus
item.text: Battlecry: Destroy your hero and replace it with Lord Jaraxxus.
item.flavor: "TRIFLING GNOME! YOUR ARROGANCE WILL BE YOUR UNDOING!!!!"

item.name: Lorewalker Cho
item.text: Whenever a player casts a spell, put a copy into the other player’s hand.
item.flavor: Lorewalker Cho archives and shares tales from the land of Pandaria, but his favorite story is the one where Joey and Phoebe go on a road trip.

item.name: Mad Bomber
item.text: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage randomly split between all other characters.
item.flavor: He's not really all that crazy, he is just not as careful with explosives as he should be.

item.name: Malygos
item.text: Spell Damage +5
item.flavor: Malygos hates it when mortals use magic. He gets so mad!

item.name: Mana Addict
item.text: Whenever you cast a spell, gain +2 Attack this turn.
item.flavor: She’s trying to kick the habit, but still takes some mana whenever she has a stressful day.

item.name: Mana Gorged
item.text: Increased attack.

item.name: Mana Tide Totem
item.text: At the end of your turn, draw a card.
item.flavor: It is said that some shaman can say "Floatin' totem" 10 times, fast.

item.name: Mana Wraith
item.text: ALL minions cost (1) more.
item.flavor: They come out at night to eat leftover mana crystals. "Mmmmmm," they say.

item.name: Mana Wyrm
item.text: Whenever you cast a spell, gain +1 Attack.
item.flavor: These wyrms feed on arcane energies, and while they are generally considered a nuisance rather than a real threat, you really shouldn't leave them alone with a bucket of mana.

item.name: Mark of Nature
item.text: Choose One - Give a minion +4 Attack; or +4 Health and Taunt.
item.flavor: Druids call it the "Mark of Nature." Everyone else calls it "needing a bath."

item.name: Mark of Nature
item.text: This minion has +4 Health and Taunt.

item.name: Mark of Nature
item.text: +4 Attack.

item.name: Mark of Nature
item.text: +4 Health and Taunt.

item.name: Mark of Nature
item.text: This minion has +4 Attack.

item.name: Mass Dispel
item.text: Silence all enemy minions. Draw a card.
item.flavor: It dispels buffs, powers, hopes, and dreams.

item.name: Master of Disguise
item.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion Stealth.
item.flavor: She's actually a male tauren. People don't call him "Master of Disguise" for nothing.

item.name: Master Swordsmith
item.text: At the end of your turn, give another random friendly minion +1 Attack.
item.flavor: He's currently trying to craft a "flail-axe", but all the other swordsmiths say it can't be done.

item.name: Millhouse Manastorm
item.text: Battlecry: Enemy spells cost (0) next turn.
item.flavor: "I'm gonna light you up, sweetcheeks!"

item.name: Mind Control Tech
item.text: Battlecry: If your opponent has 4 or more minions, take control of one at random.
item.flavor: Mind Control technology is getting better, but that's not saying much.

item.name: Mind Shatter
item.text: Hero Power Deal 3 damage.

item.name: Mind Spike
item.text: Hero Power Deal 2 damage.

item.name: Mindgames
item.text: Put a copy of a random minion from your opponent's deck into the battlefield.
item.flavor: Sometimes it feels like this is all a game.

item.name: Mirror Entity
item.text: Secret: When your opponent plays a minion, summon a copy of it.
item.flavor: "You go first." - Krush'gor the Behemoth, to his pet boar.

item.name: Misdirection
item.text: Secret: When a character attacks your hero, instead he attacks another random character.
item.flavor: Sometimes it's as simple as putting on a fake mustache and pointing at someone else.

item.name: Mogu'shan Warden
item.text: Taunt
item.flavor: All these guys ever do is talk about the Thunder King. BOOOORRRINNG!

item.name: Molten Giant
item.text: Costs (1) less for each damage your hero has taken.
item.flavor: He gets terrible heartburn. BECAUSE HE IS FULL OF LAVA.

item.name: Moonfire
item.text: Deal 2 damage.

item.name: Mortal Strike
item.text: Deal $4 damage. If you have 12 or less Health, deal $6 instead.
item.flavor: "If you only use one ability, use Mortal Strike." - The Warrior Code, Line 6

item.name: Mountain Giant
item.text: Costs (1) less for each other card in your hand.
item.flavor: His mother said that he was just big boned.

item.text: Murloc Warleader is granting +2/+1.
item.name: Mrgglaargl!

item.text: +2 Health.
item.name: Mrghlglhal
Murloc Tidecaller
item.text: Whenever a Murloc is summoned, gain +1 Attack.
item.flavor: This guy gets crazy strong at family reunions.

item.name: Murloc Warleader
item.text: ALL other Murlocs have +2/+1.
item.flavor: Do Murlocs ever get tired of making the same old sound? Nope! Mrglglrglglglglglglgl!

item.name: Nat Pagle
item.text: At the start of your turn, you have a 50% chance to draw an extra card.
item.flavor: Nat Pagle, Azeroth's premier fisherman! He invented the Auto-Angler 3000, the Extendo-Pole 3000, and the Lure-o-matic 2099 (still in testing).

item.name: Naturalize
item.text: Destroy a minion. Your opponent draws 2 cards.
item.flavor: Another one bites the dust.

item.name: Needs Sharpening
item.text: Decreased Attack.

item.name: Nightmare
item.text: Give a minion +5/+5. At the start of your next turn, destroy it.
This minion has +5/+5, but will be destroyed soon.
item.name: Nightmare
Noble Sacrifice
item.text: Secret: When an enemy attacks, summon a 2/1 Defender as the new target.
item.flavor: We will always remember you, "Defender!"

item.name: Nourish
item.text: Gain 2 Mana Crystals.

item.name: Nourish
item.text: Choose One - Gain 2 Mana Crystals; or Draw 3 cards.
item.flavor: Druids take nourishment from many things: the power of nature, the songbird's chirp, a chocolate cake.

item.name: Nourish
item.text: Draw 3 cards.

item.name: Nozdormu
item.text: Players only have 15 seconds to take their turns.
item.flavor: Time to write some flavor text.

item.name: Onyxia
item.text: Battlecry: Summon 1/1 Whelps until your side of the battlefield is full.
item.flavor: Onyxia long manipulated the Stormwind Court by disguising herself as Lady Katrana Prestor. You would have thought that the giant wings and scales would have been a giveaway.

item.name: Overloading
item.text: Increased stats.

item.name: Patient Assassin
item.text: Stealth. Destroy any minion damaged by this minion.
item.flavor: He’s not really that patient. It just takes a while for someone to walk by that he can actually reach.

item.name: Perdition's Blade
item.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage. Combo: Deal 2 instead.
item.flavor: Perdition's Blade is Ragnaros's back-up weapon while Sulfuras is in the shop.

item.name: Pint-Sized Summoner
item.text: The first minion you play each turn costs (1) less.
item.flavor: She's quite jealous of the Gallon-Sized Summoner.

item.name: Pit Lord
item.text: Battlecry: Deal 5 damage to your hero.
item.flavor: Mannoroth, Magtheridon, and Brutallus may be dead, but it turns out there are a LOT of pit lords.

item.name: Power of the Kirin Tor
item.text: Your next Secret costs (0).

item.name: Power of the Wild
item.text: Choose One - Give your minions +1/+1; or Summon a 3/2 Panther.
item.flavor: Never look a panther in the eye. Or is it 'Always look a panther in the eye'? Well, it's one of those.

item.name: Power Overwhelming
item.text: Give a friendly minion +4/+4 until end of turn. Then, it dies. Horribly.
item.flavor: We cannot even describe how horrible the death is. It's CRAZY bad! Maybe worse than that. Just don't do it.

item.name: Power Overwhelming
item.text: This minion has +4/+4, but will die a horrible death at the end of the turn.

item.name: Preparation
item.text: The next spell you cast this turn costs (3) less.

item.name: Preparation
item.text: The next spell you cast this turn costs (3) less.
item.flavor: "Be Prepared" - Rogue Motto

item.name: Priestess of Elune
item.text: Battlecry: Restore 4 Health to your hero.
item.flavor: If she threatens to "moon" you, it's not what you think.

item.name: Prophet Velen
item.text: Double the damage and healing of your spells and Hero Power.
item.flavor: He's been exiled from his home, and all his brothers turned evil, but otherwise he doesn't have a lot to complain about.

item.name: Pyroblast
item.text: Deal $10 damage.
item.flavor: Take the time for an evil laugh after you draw this card.

item.name: Questing Adventurer
item.text: Whenever you play a card, gain +1/+1.
item.flavor: "Does anyone have some extra Boar Pelts?"

item.name: Raging Worgen
item.text: Enrage: Windfury and +1 Attack
item.flavor: If he's raging now, just wait until he gets nerfed.

item.name: Ragnaros the Firelord
item.text: Can't Attack. At the end of your turn, deal 8 damage to a random enemy.
item.flavor: Ragnaros was summoned by the Dark Iron dwarves, who were eventually enslaved by the Firelord. Summoning Ragnaros often doesn’t work out the way you want it to.

item.name: Rampage
item.text: Give a damaged minion +3/+3.
item.flavor: Minion get ANGRY. Minion SMASH!

item.name: Ravenholdt Assassin
item.text: Stealth
item.flavor: Just mail him a package with a name and 10,000 gold. He'll take care of the rest.

item.name: Raw Power!
item.text: Increased stats.

item.name: Redemption
item.text: Secret: When one of your minions dies, return it to life with 1 Health.
item.flavor: I am not sure how you get demptioned the first time. It’s a mystery!

item.name: Repentance
item.text: Secret: When your opponent plays a minion, reduce its Health to 1.
item.flavor: Repentance often comes in the moment before obliteration. Curious.

item.name: Repentance
item.text: Health reduced to 1.

item.name: Rooted
item.text: +5 Health and Taunt.

item.name: Rooted
item.text: +5 Health and Taunt.

item.name: Savagery
item.text: Deal damage equal to your hero's Attack to a minion.
item.flavor: It is true that some druids are savage, but others still enjoy a quiet moment and a spot of tea.

item.name: Savannah Highmane
item.text: Deathrattle: Summon two 2/2 Hyenas.
item.flavor: In the jungle, the mighty jungle, the lion gets slowly consumed by hyenas.

item.name: Scarlet Crusader
item.text: Divine Shield
item.flavor: Never wash your whites with a Scarlet Crusader.

item.name: Scavenging Hyena
item.text: Whenever a friendly Beast dies, gain +2/+1.
item.flavor: Hyenas prefer the bones of kodos or windserpents, but they'll eat pretty much anything. Even Brussels sprouts.

item.name: Sea Giant
item.text: Costs (1) less for each other minion on the battlefield.
item.flavor: See? Giant.

item.name: Secretkeeper
item.text: Whenever a Secret is played, gain +1/+1.
item.flavor: She promises not to tell anyone about that thing you did last night with that one person.

item.name: Sense Demons
item.text: Put 2 random Demons from your deck into your hand.
item.flavor: Generally demons are pretty obvious and you don’t need a spell to sense them.

item.name: Shadow Madness
item.text: This minion has switched controllers this turn.

item.name: Shadow Madness
item.text: Gain control of an enemy minion with 3 or less Attack until end of turn.
item.flavor: You can rationalize it all you want, it's still a mean thing to do.

item.name: Shadow of Nothing
item.text: Mindgames whiffed! Your opponent had no minions!

item.name: Shadowflame
item.text: Destroy a friendly minion and deal its Attack damage to all enemy minions.
item.flavor: Start with a powerful minion and stir in Shadowflame and you have a good time!

item.name: Shadowform
item.text: Your Hero Power becomes 'Deal 2 damage'. If already in Shadowform: 3 damage.
item.flavor: If a bright light shines on a priest in Shadowform… do they cast a shadow?

item.name: Shadows of M'uru
item.text: This minion has consumed Divine Shields and has increased Attack and Health.

item.name: Shadowstep
item.text: Return a friendly minion to your hand. It costs (2) less.
item.flavor: Rogue dance troops will sometimes Shadowstep away at the end of a performance. Crowds love it.

item.name: Shan'do's Lesson
item.text: Summon two 2/2 Treants with Taunt.
+2 Attack from Spiteful Smith.
item.name: Sharp!
Shield Slam
item.text: Deal 1 damage to a minion for each Armor you have.
item.flavor: "What is a better weapon? The sharp one your enemies expect, or the blunt one they ignore?" - The Art of Warrior, Chapter 9

item.name: Shieldbearer
item.text: Taunt
item.flavor: Have you seen the size of the shields in this game?? This is no easy job.

item.name: SI:7 Agent
item.text: Combo: Deal 2 damage.
item.flavor: The agents of SI:7 are responsible for Stormwind's covert activities. Their duties include espionage, assassination, and throwing surprise birthday parties for the royal family.

item.name: Silence
item.text: Silence a minion.
item.flavor: Reserved for enemy spellcasters, evil liches from beyond the grave, and karaoke nights at the Grim Guzzler.

item.name: Silver Hand Knight
item.text: Battlecry: Summon a 2/2 Squire.
item.flavor: It's good to be a knight. Less so to be one's squire.

item.name: Silvermoon Guardian
item.text: Divine Shield
item.flavor: The first time they tried to guard Silvermoon against the scourge, it didn’t go so well…

item.name: Siphon Soul
item.text: Destroy a minion. Restore #3 Health to your hero.
item.flavor: You probably should avoid siphoning your own soul. You might create some kind of weird infinite loop.

item.name: Slam
item.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion. If it survives, draw a card.
item.flavor: "Dun da dun, dun da dun": if you've heard an ogre sing this, it's too late.

item.name: Snake Trap
item.text: Secret: When one of your minions is attacked, summon three 1/1 Snakes.
item.flavor: Why did it have to be snakes?

item.name: Snipe
item.text: Secret: When your opponent plays a minion, deal $4 damage to it.
item.flavor: A great sniper hits the spot. Just like a delicious flank of boar. Mmmmm.

item.name: Sorcerer's Apprentice
item.text: Your spells cost (1) less.
item.flavor: Apprentices are great for bossing around. "Conjure me some mana buns! And a coffee! Make that a mana coffee!"

item.name: Soul of the Forest
item.text: Give your minions "Deathrattle: Summon a 2/2 Treant."
item.flavor: "Reforestation" is suddenly a terrifying word.

item.name: Soul of the Forest
item.text: Deathrattle: Summon a 2/2 Treant.

item.name: Southsea Captain
item.text: Your other Pirates have +1/+1.
item.flavor: When he saves enough plunder, he's going to commission an enormous captain's hat. He has hat envy.

item.name: Southsea Deckhand
item.text: Has Charge while you have a weapon equipped.
item.flavor: Pirates are into this new fad called "Planking".

item.name: Spellbender
item.text: Secret: When an enemy casts a spell on a minion, summon a 1/3 as the new target.
item.flavor: While it's fun to intercept enemy lightning bolts, a spellbender much prefers to intercept opposing Marks of the Wild. It just feels meaner. And blood elves... well, they're a little mean.

item.name: Spellbreaker
item.text: Battlecry: Silence a minion.
item.flavor: Spellbreakers can rip enchantments from magic-wielders. The process is painless and can be performed on an outpatient basis.

item.name: Spirit Wolf
item.text: Taunt

item.name: Spiteful Smith
item.text: Enrage: Your weapon has +2 Attack.
item.flavor: She'll craft you a sword, but you'll need to bring her 5 Steel Ingots, 3 Motes of Earth, and the scalp of her last customer.

item.name: Stampeding Kodo
item.text: Battlecry: Destroy a random enemy minion with 2 or less Attack.
item.flavor: This Kodo is so big that he can stampede by himself.

item.name: Stand Down!
item.text: Attack changed to 1.

item.name: Starfall
item.text: Deal $5 damage to a minion.

item.name: Starfall
item.text: Deal $2 damage to all enemy minions.

item.name: Starfall
item.text: Choose One - Deal $5 damage to a minion; or $2 damage to all enemy minions.
item.flavor: Is the sky falling? Yes. Yes it is.

item.name: Stormforged Axe
item.text: Overload: (1)
item.flavor: Yo, that's a nice axe.

item.name: Stranglethorn Tiger
item.text: Stealth
item.flavor: The wonderful thing about tigers is tigers are wonderful things!

item.text: Dire Wolf Alpha is granting +1 Attack to this minion.
item.name: Strength of the Pack
Summon a Panther
item.text: Summon a 3/2 Panther.

item.name: Summoning Portal
item.text: Your minions cost (2) less, but not less than (1).
item.flavor: NOT LESS THAN 1! Don't get any ideas!

item.name: Sunfury Protector
item.text: Battlecry: Give adjacent minions Taunt.
item.flavor: She carries a shield, but only so she can give it to someone she can stand behind.

item.name: Sunwalker
item.text: Taunt. Divine Shield
item.flavor: She doesn’t ACTUALLY walk on the Sun. It's just a name. Don’t worry!

item.name: Sword of Justice
item.text: Whenever you summon a minion, give it +1/+1 and this loses 1 Durability.
item.flavor: I dub you Sir Loin of Beef!

item.name: Sylvanas Windrunner
item.text: Deathrattle: Take control of a random enemy minion.
item.flavor: Sylvanas was turned into the Banshee Queen by Arthas, but he probably should have just killed her because it just pissed her off.

item.name: Tauren Warrior
item.text: Taunt. Enrage: +3 Attack
item.flavor: Tauren Warrior: Champion of Mulgore, Slayer of Quilboar, Rider of Thunderbluff Elevators.

item.text: Spell Damage +1.
item.name: Teachings of the Kirin Tor
Tempered
item.text: +2 Attack this turn.

item.name: Temple Enforcer
item.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion +3 Health.
item.flavor: He also moonlights Thursday nights as a bouncer at the Pig and Whistle Tavern.

item.name: The Beast
item.text: Deathrattle: Summon a 3/3 Finkle Einhorn for your opponent.
item.flavor: He lives in Blackrock Mountain. He eats Gnomes. That's pretty much it.

item.name: The Black Knight
item.text: Battlecry: Destroy an enemy minion with Taunt.
item.flavor: He was sent by the Lich King to disrupt the Argent Tournament. We can pretty much mark that a failure.

item.name: Thoughtsteal
item.text: Copy 2 cards from your opponent's deck and put them into your hand.
item.flavor: "What do you get when you cast Thoughtsteal on an Orc? Nothing!" - Tauren joke

item.name: Thrallmar Farseer
item.text: Windfury
item.flavor: He's stationed in the Hellfire Peninsula, but he's hoping for a reassignment closer to Orgrimmar, or really anywhere the ground is less on fire.

item.name: Tinkmaster Overspark
item.text: Battlecry: Transform another random minion into a 5/5 Devilsaur or a 1/1 Squirrel.
item.flavor: Tinkmaster Overspark nearly lost his Tinker's license after the Great Ironforge Squirrel Stampede of '09.

item.name: Tirion Fordring
item.text: Divine Shield. Taunt. Deathrattle: Equip a 5/3 Ashbringer.
item.flavor: If you haven't heard the Tirion Fordring theme song, it's because it doesn't exist.

item.name: Trapped
item.text: Will be Frozen again at the start of the next turn.

item.name: Treant
item.text: Charge. At the end of the turn, destroy this minion.

item.text: Taunt
Increased Attack.

Twilight Drake
item.text: Battlecry: Gain +1 Health for each card in your hand.
item.flavor: Twilight drakes feed on Mystical Energy. And Tacos.

item.name: Twisting Nether
item.text: Destroy all minions.
item.flavor: The Twisting Nether is a formless place of magic and illusion and destroyed minions.

item.name: Unbound Elemental
item.text: Whenever you play a card with Overload, gain +1/+1.
item.flavor: Unlike bound elementals, Unbound ones really enjoy a night on the town.

item.name: Unleash the Hounds
item.text: For each enemy minion, summon a 1/1 Hound with Charge.
item.flavor: You must read the name of this card out loud each time you play it.

item.name: Upgrade!
item.text: If you have a weapon, give it +1/+1. Otherwise equip a 1/3 weapon.
item.flavor: Easily worth 50 DKP.

item.text: +1 Attack and +1 Durability.

item.text: Increased Durability.

item.text: +5 Attack.

item.name: Uprooted
item.text: +5 Attack.

item.name: VanCleef's Vengeance
item.text: This minion has increased Attack and Health.

item.name: Vaporize
item.text: Secret: When a minion attacks your hero, destroy it.
item.flavor: Rumor has it that Deathwing brought about the Cataclysm after losing a game to this card. We may never know the truth.

item.name: Venture Co. Mercenary
item.text: Your minions cost (3) more.
item.flavor: No Job is too big. No fee is too big.

item.name: Violet Teacher
item.text: Whenever you cast a spell, summon a 1/1 Violet Apprentice.
item.flavor: If you don't pay attention, you may be turned into a pig. And then you get your name on the board.

item.name: Void Terror
item.text: Battlecry: Destroy the minions on either side of this minion and gain their Attack and Health.
item.flavor: If you put this into your deck, you WILL lose the trust of your other minions.

Well Fed

item.text: +2 Attack.

item.name: Wild Pyromancer
item.text: After you cast a spell, deal 1 damage to ALL minions.
item.flavor: BOOM BABY BOOM! BAD IS GOOD! DOWN WITH GOVERNMENT!

item.name: Windfury Harpy
item.text: Windfury
item.flavor: Harpies are not pleasant sounding. That's the nicest I can put it.

item.name: Wisp
item.flavor: If you hit an Eredar Lord with enough Wisps, it will explode. But why?

item.name: Worgen Infiltrator
item.text: Stealth
item.flavor: If you want to stop a worgen from infiltrating, just yell, "No! Bad boy!"

item.name: Worthless Imp
item.text: You are out of demons! At least there are always imps...

item.name: Wrath
item.text: Choose One - Deal $3 damage to a minion; or $1 damage and draw a card.
item.flavor: The talk around the Ratchet Inn is that this card is too good and should be a Legendary.

item.name: Wrath
item.text: Deal $3 damage to a minion.

Southsea Captain is granting +1/+1.
item.name: Yarrr!
Young Dragonhawk
item.text: Windfury
item.flavor: They were the inspiration for the championship Taurenball team: The Dragonhawks.

item.name: Young Priestess
item.text: At the end of your turn, give another random friendly minion +1 Health.
item.flavor: She can't wait to learn Power Word: Fortitude Rank 2.

item.name: Extra Sharp
Feign Death
item.text: Trigger all Deathrattles on your minions.
item.flavor: The hardest part about doing a "Feign Death" convincingly is learning how to make the right smell. It takes a lot of commitment.

item.name: Fel Cannon
item.text: At the end of your turn, deal 2 damage to a non-Mech minion.
item.flavor: The box says, "New and improved, with 200% more fel!"

item.name: Fel Reaver
item.text: Whenever your opponent plays a card, discard the top 3 cards of your deck.
item.flavor: So reaver. Much fel. Wow.

item.name: Finicky Cloakfield
item.text: Give a friendly minion Stealth until your next turn.

item.name: Flame Leviathan
item.text: When you draw this, deal 2 damage to all characters.
item.flavor: Mimiron likes to take the Flame Leviathan out on some sweet joyrides.

item.name: Flamecannon
item.text: Deal $4 damage to a random enemy minion.
item.flavor: Calling something a flamecannon really doesn't do much to distinguish it from other goblin devices.

item.name: Floating Watcher
item.text: Whenever your hero takes damage on your turn, gain +2/+2.
item.flavor: "Evil Eye Watcher of Doom" was the original name, but marketing felt it was a bit too aggressive.

item.name: Flying Machine
item.text: Windfury
item.flavor: To operate, this contraption needs a hula doll on the dashboard. Otherwise it's just a “falling machine.”

item.name: Foe Reaper 4000
item.text: Also damages the minions next to whomever he attacks.
item.flavor: Foe reaping is really not so different from harvest reaping, at the end of the day.

item.name: Force-Tank MAX
item.text: Divine Shield
item.flavor: There is a factory in Tanaris for crafting force-tanks, but it only ever made two, because of cost overruns.

item.name: Gahz'rilla
item.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, double its Attack.
item.flavor: The Sen'jin High football team is The Gahz'rillas.

item.name: Gallywix's Coin
item.text: Gain 1 Mana Crystal this turn only. (Won't trigger Gallywix.)

item.name: Gazlowe
item.text: Whenever you cast a 1-mana spell, add a random Mech to your hand.
item.flavor: Gazlowe was voted "Most Likely to Explode" in high school.

item.name: Gift of Cards
item.text: Each player draws a card.

item.name: Gift of Mana
item.text: Give each player a Mana Crystal.

item.name: Gilblin Stalker
item.text: Stealth
item.flavor:
"Shhh, I think I hear something."
"Ah, it's probably nothing." - Every Henchman

item.name: Glaivezooka
item.text: +1 Attack.

item.name: Glaivezooka
item.text: Battlecry: Give a random friendly minion +1 Attack.
item.flavor: For the times when a regular bazooka just isn't enough.

item.name: Gnomeregan Infantry
item.text: Charge Taunt
item.flavor: The gnomes are valiant and ready to return to their irradiated, poorly ventilated homeland!

item.name: Gnomish Experimenter
item.text: Battlecry: Draw a card. If it's a minion, transform it into a Chicken.
item.flavor: He's legitimately surprised every time he turns himself into a chicken.

item.name: Goblin Auto-Barber
item.text: Battlecry: Give your weapon +1 Attack.
item.flavor: This guy is excellent at adjusting your haircut and/or height.

item.name: Goblin Blastmage
item.text: Battlecry: If you have a Mech, deal 4 damage randomly split among all enemies.
item.flavor: If you can't find a bomb to throw, just pick up any goblin invention and throw that.

item.name: Goblin Sapper
item.text: Has +4 Attack while your opponent has 6 or more cards in hand.
item.flavor: He’s not such a binge exploder anymore. These days, he only explodes socially.

item.name: Grasp of Mal'Ganis
item.text: Mal'Ganis is granting +2/+2.

item.name: Grove Tender
item.text: Choose One - Give each player a Mana Crystal; or Each player draws a card.
item.flavor: Likes: Hiking and the great outdoors. Dislikes: Goblin shredders and sandals. (Can’t find any that fit!).

item.name: Hemet Nesingwary
item.text: Battlecry: Destroy a Beast.
item.flavor: It's hard to make a living as a hunter in a world where beasts instantly reappear minutes after you kill them.

item.name: Hobgoblin
item.text: Whenever you play a 1-Attack minion, give it +2/+2.
item.flavor: Hobgoblins are meeting next week to discuss union benefits. First on the list: dental plan.

item.name: Illuminator
item.text: If you control a Secret at the end of your turn, restore 4 health to your hero.
item.flavor: "LUMOS!" is not what they yell. What do you think this is, Hogwarts?

item.name: Imp-losion
item.text: Deal $2-$4 damage to a minion. Summon a 1/1 Imp for each damage dealt.
item.flavor: The shrapnel is waaaaay worse than the explosion.

item.name: Iron Juggernaut
item.text: Battlecry: Shuffle a Mine into your opponent's deck. When drawn, it explodes for 10 damage.
item.flavor: The Iron Juggernaut guards Orgrimmar and has just earned the "Employee of the Month" award!

item.name: Iron Sensei
item.text: At the end of your turn, give another friendly Mech +2/+2.
item.flavor:
Mechs like learning from him because he really speaks their language.
0110100001101001

item.name: Ironed Out
item.text: Increased stats.

item.name: Jeeves
item.text: At the end of each player's turn, that player draws until they have 3 cards.
item.flavor: This robot is a lean, mean, butlerin' machine.

item.name: Junkbot
item.text: Whenever a friendly Mech dies, gain +2/+2.
item.flavor: One bot's junk is another bot's AWESOME UPGRADE!

item.text: Increased stats.
item.name: Junked Up
Kezan Mystic
item.text: Battlecry: Take control of a random enemy Secret.
item.flavor: They pretend to be wise and enlightened, but they mostly just hate to be left out of a secret.

item.name: King of Beasts
item.text: Taunt. Battlecry: Gain +1 Attack for each other Beast you have.
item.flavor: He never sleeps. Not even in the mighty jungle.

item.name: Light of the Naaru
item.text: Restore #3 Health. If the target is still damaged, summon a Lightwarden.
item.flavor: "Light it up!" - Command given to both Lightwardens and Goblins holding Flamecannons.

item.name: Lightbomb
item.text: Deal damage to each minion equal to its Attack.
item.flavor: This is what happens when you allow goblins to be priests.

item.name: Lil' Exorcist
item.text: Taunt Battlecry: Gain +1/+1 for each enemy Deathrattle minion.
item.flavor: Warlocks have the town exorcist on speed dial in case they unleash the wrong demon.

item.name: Lost Tallstrider
item.flavor: The message, "If found, please return to Mulgore," is tattooed on his rear.

item.name: Madder Bomber
item.text: Battlecry: Deal 6 damage randomly split between all other characters.
item.flavor: Dang, Bomber, calm down.

item.name: Mal'Ganis
item.text: Your other Demons have +2/+2. Your hero is Immune.
item.flavor: Mal'Ganis doesn't like being betrayed, so if you discard him, watch out.

item.name: Malorne
item.text: Deathrattle: Shuffle this minion into your deck.
item.flavor: When Malorne isn't mauling hordes of demons, he enjoys attending parties, though he prefers to go stag.

item.name: Mech-Bear-Cat
item.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, add a Spare Part card to your hand.
item.flavor: Crushes buildings with his BEAR hands.

item.name: Mechanical Yeti
item.text: Deathrattle: Give each player a Spare Part.
item.flavor: The yetis of Chillwind Point are a source of both inspiration and savage beatings.

item.name: Mechwarper
item.text: Your Mechs cost (1) less.
item.flavor: Mechs that summon mechs? What's next? Donuts that summon donuts? Mmmmm.

item.name: Mekgineer Thermaplugg
item.text: Whenever an enemy minion dies, summon a Leper Gnome.
item.flavor: He was obsessed with explosives until he discovered knitting. Now he yells, “SWEATERS! MORE SWEATERS!”

item.name: Metabolized Magic
item.text: Increased Attack.

item.name: Metabolized Magic
item.text: Increased Attack.

item.name: Metal Teeth
item.text: +2 Attack.

item.name: Metaltooth Leaper
item.text: Battlecry: Give your other Mechs +2 Attack.
item.flavor: Don't leave them out in the rain. In Un'Goro Crater there is a whole colony of rust-tooth leapers.

item.name: Micro Machine
item.text: At the start of each turn, gain +1 Attack.
item.flavor: This card is the real thing.

item.name: Might of Zul'Farrak
item.text: Multiplying Attack.

item.name: Mimiron's Head
item.text: At the start of your turn, if you have at least 3 Mechs, destroy them all and form V-07-TR-0N.
item.flavor: Do not push the big red button!

item.name: Mini-Mage
item.text: Stealth Spell Damage +1
item.flavor: He is sometimes found hiding in the treasure chest in the Gurubashi Arena.

item.name: Mistress of Pain
item.text: Whenever this minion deals damage, restore that much Health to your hero.
item.flavor: Her sister is the Mistress of Pane who sells windows and shower doors.

item.name: Mogor the Ogre
item.text: All minions have a 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.
item.flavor: Mogor helped reopen the Dark Portal once. You know you're in trouble when you have to rely on an ogre.

item.name: Muster for Battle
item.text: Summon three 1/1 Silver Hand Recruits. Equip a 1/4 Weapon.
item.flavor: "I'm bringing the guacamole!" – One of the most successful (yet rare) Silver Hand rallying cries

item.name: Neptulon
item.text: Battlecry: Add 4 random Murlocs to your hand. Overload: (3)
item.flavor: Neptulon is "The Tidehunter". He’s one of the four elemental lords. And he and Ragnaros get together and make really amazing saunas.

item.name: Ogre Brute
item.text: 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.
item.flavor: Ogres have really terrible short-term chocolate.

item.name: Ogre Ninja
item.text: Stealth 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.
item.flavor: He didn't have the grades to get into ninja school, but his dad pulled some strings.

item.name: Ogre Warmaul
item.text: 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.
item.flavor: Simple, misguided, and incredibly dangerous. You know, like most things ogre.

item.name: One-eyed Cheat
item.text: Whenever you summon a Pirate, gain Stealth.
item.flavor: When pirates say there is no "Eye" in "team," they are very literal about it.

item.name: Overclocked
item.text: Spell Damage +2.

item.name: Piloted Shredder
item.text: Deathrattle: Summon a random 2-Cost minion.
item.flavor: Once upon a time, only goblins piloted shredders. These days, everyone from Doomsayer to Lorewalker Cho seems to ride one.

item.name: Piloted Sky Golem
item.text: Deathrattle: Summon a random 4-Cost minion.
item.flavor: The pinnacle of goblin engineering. Includes an espresso machine and foot massager.

item.text: Increased Attack.
item.name: Pistons
Powermace
item.text: Deathrattle: Give a random friendly Mech +2/+2.
item.flavor: People assume that shamans control the elements, but really, they have to ask them stuff and the elements are like, "Yeah ok, sure."

item.name: Puddlestomper
item.flavor: He pays homage to Morgl, the great murloc oracle! (Who doesn't??)

item.name: Pure
item.text: Increased Stats.

item.name: Quartermaster
item.text: Battlecry: Give your Silver Hand Recruits +2/+2.
item.flavor: His specialty? Dividing things into four pieces.

item.name: Recombobulator
item.text: Battlecry: Transform a friendly minion into a random minion with the same Cost.
item.flavor: For when you didn’t combobulate quite right the first time around.

item.name: Recycle
item.text: Shuffle an enemy minion into your opponent's deck.
item.flavor: Druidic recycling involves putting plastics in one bin and enemy minions in another bin.

item.name: Repairs!
item.text: +4 Health.
Increased Attack
item.name: Retribution
Reversing Switch
item.text: Swap a minion's Attack and Health.

item.name: Rusty Horn
item.text: Give a minion Taunt.

item.name: Sabotage
item.text: Destroy a random enemy minion. Combo: And your opponent's weapon.
item.flavor: Rogues can't stand it. They know you planned it! They are going to set you straight!

item.name: Salty Dog
item.flavor: He's recently recovered from being a "scurvy dog."

item.name: Scarlet Purifier
item.text: Battlecry: Deal 2 damage to all minions with Deathrattle.
item.flavor: The Scarlet Crusade is doing market research to find out if the "Mauve Crusade" would be better received.

item.name: Screwjank Clunker
item.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly Mech +2/+2.
item.flavor: If it breaks, just kick it a couple of times while yelling "Durn thing!"

item.name: Seal of Light
item.text: Restore #4 Health to your hero and gain +2 Attack this turn.
item.flavor: The walrus of Light restores EIGHT Health.

item.name: Seal of Light
item.text: +2 Attack this turn.

item.name: Shadowbomber
item.text: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage to each hero.
item.flavor: Shadowbomber does her job, but she's kind of phoning it in at this point.

item.name: Shadowboxer
item.text: Whenever a character is healed, deal 1 damage to a random enemy.
item.flavor: Punching is its primary function. Also, its secondary function.

item.name: Shadowed
item.text: Health was swapped.

item.name: Shielded Minibot
item.text: Divine Shield
item.flavor: He chooses to believe what he is programmed to believe!

item.name: Shieldmaiden
item.text: Battlecry: Gain 5 Armor.
item.flavor: She has three shieldbearers in her party to supply her with back ups when she gets low on durability.

item.name: Ship's Cannon
item.text: Whenever you summon a Pirate, deal 2 damage to a random enemy.
item.flavor: If you hear someone yell, "Cannonball!" you're about to get wet. Or crushed.

item.name: Shrink Ray
item.text: -2 Attack this turn.

item.name: Shrinkmeister
item.text: Battlecry: Give a minion -2 Attack this turn.
item.flavor: After the debacle of the Gnomish World Enlarger, gnomes are wary of size-changing inventions.

item.name: Siege Engine
item.text: Whenever you gain Armor, give this minion +1 Attack.
item.flavor: Wintergrasp Keep's only weakness!

item.name: Siltfin Spiritwalker
item.text: Whenever another friendly Murloc dies, draw a card. Overload: (1)
item.flavor: The elements respond to anyone who calls them for a worthy cause, even if you call them by yelling, "MRGHRGLGLGL!"

item.name: Sneed's Old Shredder
item.text: Deathrattle: Summon a random legendary minion.
item.flavor: When Sneed was defeated in the Deadmines, his shredder was sold at auction to an anonymous buyer. (Probably Hogger.)

item.name: Snowchugger
item.text: Freeze any character damaged by this minion.
item.flavor: Do the slow chant when he waddles by: "Chug! Chug! Chug!"

item.name: Soot Spewer
item.text: Spell Damage +1
item.flavor: The inventor of the goblin shredder is involved in several patent disputes with the inventor of the soot spewer.

item.name: Spider Tank
item.flavor: "What if we put guns on it?" -Fizzblitz, staring at the spider-transportation-machine

item.name: Steamwheedle Sniper
item.text: Your Hero Power can target minions.
item.flavor: Goblins seldom have the patience for sniping. Most prefer lobbing explosives.

item.name: Stonesplinter Trogg
item.text: Whenever your opponent casts a spell, gain +1 Attack.
item.flavor: The only thing worse than smelling troggs is listening to their poetry.

item.text: Attack and Health have been swapped by Reversing Switch.
item.name: Switched
Tank Mode
item.text: +1 Health.

item.name: Tank Mode
item.text: +1 Health.

item.name: Target Dummy
item.text: Taunt
item.flavor: The engineering equivalent of a "Kick Me" sticker.

item.name: The King
item.text: Increased Attack.

item.name: Time Rewinder
item.text: Return a friendly minion to your hand.

item.name: Tinker's Sharpsword Oil
item.text: Give your weapon +3 Attack. Combo: Give a random friendly minion +3 Attack.
item.flavor: "Get ready to strike oil!" - Super-cheesy battle cry

item.text: +3 Attack.
item.name: Tinker's Sharpsword Oil

item.text: +3 Attack.
item.name: Tinker's Sharpsword Oil
Tinkertown Technician
item.text: Battlecry: If you have a Mech, gain +1/+1 and add a Spare Part to your hand.
item.flavor: Won't you take me to... Tinkertown?

item.name: Toshley
item.text: Battlecry and Deathrattle: Add a Spare Part card to your hand.
item.flavor: Something about power converters.

item.name: Trade Prince Gallywix
item.text: Whenever your opponent casts a spell, gain a copy of it and give them a Coin.
item.flavor: Gallywix believes in supply and demand. He supplies the beatings and demands you pay up!

item.name: Tree of Life
item.text: Restore all characters to full Health.
item.flavor: Healing: It grows on trees!

item.name: Troggzor the Earthinator
item.text: Whenever your opponent casts a spell, summon a Burly Rockjaw Trogg.
item.flavor: He keeps earthinating the countryside despite attempts to stop him.

item.name: Unstable Portal
item.text: Add a random minion to your hand. It costs (3) less.
item.flavor: The denizens of Azeroth have no idea how much work goes into stabilizing portals. We spend like 30% of GDP on portal upkeep.

item.name: Upgraded Repair Bot
item.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly Mech +4 Health.
item.flavor: It's the same as the previous generation but they slapped the word "upgraded" on it to sell it for double.

item.name: V-07-TR-0N
item.text: Charge Mega-Windfury (Can attack four times a turn.)
+2/+4 and Spell Damage +1.
item.name: Velen's Chosen
Velen's Chosen
item.text: Give a minion +2/+4 and Spell Damage +1.
item.flavor: Velen wrote a "Lovely Card" for Tyrande with a picture of the Deeprun Tram that said "I Choo-Choo-Choose you!"

item.name: Vitality Totem
item.text: At the end of your turn, restore 4 Health to your hero.
item.flavor: You can usually find these at the totemist's market on Saturdays.

item.name: Vol'jin
item.text: Battlecry: Swap Health with another minion.
item.flavor: Vol'jin is a shadow hunter, which is like a shadow priest except more voodoo.

item.name: Warbot
item.text: Enrage: +1 Attack.
item.flavor: Mass production of warbots was halted when it was discovered that they were accidentally being produced at "sample size."

item.name: Wee Spellstopper
item.text: Adjacent minions can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.
item.flavor: Bane of spellcasters and spelling bees everywhere.

item.text: +1 Attack.
item.name: Whirling Blades
Whirling Blades
item.text: Give a minion +1 Attack.

item.name: Whirling Zap-o-matic
item.text: Windfury
item.flavor: If you pay a little extra, you can get it in "candy-apple red."
